results.text: You severely misjudged who is able to be bribed or the offer you made isn’t enough. The individual calls local law enforcement on you [[/r 1d4]] hours later. You must pay a fine double the amount you were using to bribe or be arrested.
Your argument is so poor that you convince the target to take the opposite course of action.
You’re embarrassed by what just came out of your mouth. You gain one level of Strife.
Your attempt at flattery falls, well, flat. The target creature’s attitude towards you decreases by one step.
Your attempts at persuading the other side only causes them to double down on their position. You have disadvantage on your next Persuasion roll against the target creature.
You try to talk your way into certain social circles but people aren’t buying it. For the next 24 hours important figures in the settlement actively avoid meeting with you.
